* Suppose that <math>\Gamma</math> is a finite set of <math>\mathcal{L}</math> -formulas and <math>\phi</math> is an <math>\mathcal{L}</math> -formula. 
** We will say that <math>\phi</math> is a propositional consequence of <math>\Gamma</math> if:
***<math>\phi_{P}</math> is a [[Propositional Consequence|propositional consequence]] of <math>\Gamma_{P},</math>
*** where <math>\phi_{P}</math> and <math>\Gamma_{P}</math> are the results of applying the [[Formula Conversion from FOL to PL|formula conversion algorithm]] uniformly to <math>\phi</math> and all of the formulas in <math>\Gamma</math>.
